content: yo pull through 2 loops on hook yo pull through final 2 loops on hook invisible join do not join after completing last st of round cut yarn tr2tog and pull yarn through st yo 2 times insert hook in first st yo pull up a loop insert hook from back-to-front of 2nd st of round grab yo pull through 2 loops on hook 2 times yarn and gently pull through yo 2 times insert hook in next st yo pull through st from the back insert yo pull through 2 loops on hook 2 times hook from bottom-to-top yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook of the center of last st of bptr2tog round pull yarn gently yo 2 times insert hook from back-to-front-to-back through st around post so post is in back of post yo and pull anchor on backside by yarn through hook drawing through any back yo and draw through 2 loops on hook 2 times loop of first and last sts of round and weave in ends yo twice and insert hook from back-to-front-to-back around post so post is in back of post video at a yarn of serendipity yo and draw through 2 loops on hook 2 times yo pull through all 3 loops on your hook bpsc insert hook from back-to-front-to-back around post popcorn so post is in back of your hook yo and pull up a loop work 3 double_crochet into same st drop loop from your hook yo and pull through remaining 2 loops on hook insert hook from front-to-back-to-front under top 2 loops of 1st double_crochet of group grab dropped loop with hook and pull through hook shell fpsc2tog lauren rose square a yarn of serendipity copyright © 2023 page 2 of 13 work 7 treble_crochet in same st 3lp of half_double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet and treble_crochet sts all have two main loops the v on shallow st top of each st is known as the fl front loop and bl insert hook into the v part of the stitch front and back loop back loop of stitch and complete indicated stitch the yo at the beginning of half_double_crochet double_crochet and treble_crochet sts creates the 3rd loop symbol guide asterisks * to repeat instructions after a single asterisk as directed example *single_crochet in chain-1 space chain 1 skip next half_double_crochet single_crochet in next chain-1 space chain 1 skip next fpdc repeat from * around parentheses indicates a group of sts that are worked together in or around the same st i also use parentheses to indicate the name of sts skipped example #1 2 double_crochet chain 2 2 double_crochet in chain-2 space example #2 skip next 2 half_double_crochet chain-1 space 2 half_double_crochet brackets repeat instructions within brackets as directed example double_crochet chain 1 double_crochet in next double_crochet chain 1 skip treble_crochet 2 times count totals total chain spaces are included in the st count corner chain spaces are not included in the total example counts 48 double_crochet
